roles.name: Network Engineer
roles.description: Designs, implements, and maintains communication networks (cellular, fiber, satellite) ensuring coverage and performance.

meta.typicalBackground: Telecommunications or network engineering degree, RF design knowledge, routing protocols
challenges: Spectrum constraints, licensing, varying terrain coverage, capacity demands from data-hungry users

sampleUseCase.scenario: A network engineer upgrades a city's LTE infrastructure to 5G small cells, drastically increasing data throughput in dense urban areas.

roles.name: Spectrum Policy Manager
roles.description: Develops and enforces rules for radio frequency allocation and usage, balancing commercial, government, and public interests.

meta.typicalBackground: Regulatory/policy background, technical understanding of RF, stakeholder negotiation
challenges: Competing claims from defense, commercial operators, unlicensed usage, emerging 5G/6G standards

sampleUseCase.scenario: A policy manager auctions vacant mid-band frequencies, ensuring fair conditions for multiple telecom operators while preserving emergency service channels.

roles.name: Telecom Sales Representative
roles.description: Markets and sells telecommunication services (mobile plans, broadband, enterprise solutions) to individual or corporate customers.

meta.typicalBackground: Sales or marketing background, product knowledge of telecom services, good communication skills
challenges: Fierce price competition, churn management, aligning product features with customer needs

sampleUseCase.scenario: A rep offers a custom enterprise data plan with guaranteed service levels to a growing IT startup, securing a 2-year contract for dedicated bandwidth.

roles.name: 5G Infrastructure Specialist
roles.description: Deploys and optimizes 5G networks, ensuring low latency, high throughput, and capacity for modern digital services.

meta.typicalBackground: Wireless engineering, understanding of mmWave frequencies, small cell deployments, advanced modulations
challenges: Signal obstruction in dense areas, cost of densification, ensuring backward compatibility with 4G/LTE

sampleUseCase.scenario: A specialist performs site surveys, installs small cells, and calibrates advanced beamforming features in a stadium, delivering lag-free streaming to tens of thousands of fans.

roles.name: Customer Support Lead
roles.description: Heads the team resolving technical or billing issues, ensuring high service quality and user satisfaction.

meta.typicalBackground: Customer service experience in telecom or IT, knowledge of troubleshooting common network/device issues
challenges: Handling escalated complaints, large call volumes, training support agents on new technologies

sampleUseCase.scenario: During a regional network outage, the support lead quickly dispatches a crisis response, notifies affected customers, and coordinates with engineering to restore service, reducing negative social media sentiment.
